Posts.Content: popples1108 wrote: Hello. I've posted on here a couple times over the past few days about my mom's bc. She was originally DX in 2015 and had a lumpectomy then rads. She was recently re-diagnosed with IDC. We just left the oncologist and have learned she will need 16 weeks of chemo, then a bilateral mastectomy, then possibly radiation again (on the armpit) depending on what the lymph nodes show. We also know that the tumor is 1.5cm, triple negative and Ki67 is 80%. Can someone explain a little more about what all this means, is this something that's beatable/how bad is it? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just left ONC, Triple Neg, Ki67 80% popples1108 popples1108

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2017 02:02PM popples1108 wrote: Thank you!  It makes me feel better, I guess, looking for stories and all the information I can.  I have been able to go to all her appoitments so far and can hopefully keep going to those with her.  I've also suggested this site to her, too, so she can talk to you all too.
